meanings.definition: To serve as a cochair in a meeting or organization.
meanings.sent1: During the meeting, Sarah and John were cochairing the discussion.
meanings.sent2: The team will be cochairing the upcoming event to ensure smooth coordination.
meanings.sent3: When the two friends ended up cochairing the event, it became a hilarious comedy of errors.
meanings.sent4: Their seamless cochairing of the project was like a well-choreographed dance.
meanings.sent5: The concept of cochairing involves working together closely to lead effectively.

meanings.definition: The act of sharing the responsibilities of chairing with another person.
meanings.sent1: The cochairing of the committee allowed for a balanced workload.
meanings.sent2: Effective cochairing requires good communication and teamwork.
meanings.sent3: The cochairing arrangement turned out to be a great way to divide tasks efficiently.
meanings.sent4: Their cochairing dynamic was like a tag team, seamlessly passing the baton of leadership.
meanings.sent5: The concept of cochairing promotes collaboration and shared leadership.
